author: wackerow
content: <@992497067878518875> <@420951281910284289> <@550420431744794624> <https://gist.github.com/wackerow/205b801eab413ea0fa638bc56e1d59ce> Extracted the latest copy from the `main` branch and dropped it into this gist if you wanna take a look. From where I stand we don't really have much before sending these for translations

author: wackerow
content:
The copy looked good to me, except for the from/to date in the first FAQ question... realizing that we have placeholder text.
I would suggest these get extracted as variables, so the translations can work around them.
If we want to be able to update this without committing git changes, we could consider using `.env` vars such as `REACT_APP_START_DATE` and `REACT_APP_END_DATE`, then rendering these using `(new Date(start-or-end-date)).toLocaleDateString()` so it renders the date using the users locale.

author: wackerow
content: <https://github.com/zkparty/trusted-setup-frontend/pull/83> PR to fix the from/to date
